intro: Languas foxworthyi, commonly known as the Foxworth's langua, is a rare flowering plant native to the arid regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from pink to deep red. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
